forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 9 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 49. West wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The skies over Downtown San Francisco awaken draped in a thick veil of clouds, suggesting an embrace from the lingering moisture of the night. As the morning advances, the promise of rain still looms, cloaked in the soft whispers of wind gusting from the west-southwest. The temperature hovers delicately around the mid-58s, but will slide gently into the 50s as the day unfolds—inviting one to dress with layers, perhaps a snug sweater beneath a weatherproof jacket, perfect for warding off both the breeze and the impending drizzle.

The urban landscape is shrouded in a muted, grey luminescence, lacking the sharp clarity typically offered by sunlight. Fog swirls delicately, blurring the outlines of familiar structures, lending an air of mystique to the journey ahead. With the humidity rising, and the certainty of rainfall increasing, it may be wise to plan for indoor pursuits—a leisurely stroll through local galleries, perhaps, or a stop at a cozy café to savor the bittersweet notes of a well-brewed coffee as the city indulges in serenity amidst the rain.
